org.xlattice.httpd

Class SiteList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.crypto.SignedList
      • org.xlattice.httpd.SiteList

  • public class SiteList
extends org.xlattice.crypto.SignedList
    Serialized, a site list is a list of Web site names. The names must end with a File.separator. Lines end with CRLF. XXX TODO: Change to sort entries, using this to eliminate XXX any duplicates. XXX Also ADD PORT NUMBERS with default to 80.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Method Detail

      • readContents

        protected void readContents(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                     throws org.xlattice.CryptoException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Read a series of content lines, each consisting of a simple name. This is an Internet domain name and so may contain no spaces or other delimiters. The name must end with the file separator (File.separator). The text of the line, excluding the line terminator, is included in the digest.
        Specified by:
        readContents in class org.xlattice.crypto.SignedList
        Throws:
        org.xlattice.CryptoException
        java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        the number of content lines

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int n)
        Specified by:
        toString in class org.xlattice.crypto.SignedList
        Parameters:
        n - zero-based content line index
        Returns:
        the Nth content line in String form

      • add

        public SiteList add(java.lang.String name)
        Add a content line to the SiteList. The line is just a domain name terminated by a File.separator.
        Parameters:
        name - file or path name of item
        Returns:
        reference to this SiteList, to ease chaining
